page.title: 10Leaden Roding Fire Station 1
page.content: The first recorded fire station was in 1844. In those days the fire engine was drawn by horses, which had to be collected from the fields and attached to the fire engine before they could attend a fire. That engine still stood in it's original station until the Second World War and this was the only Roding to have a fire station. In 1948, following the formation of the National Fire Service, Essex formed the Essex County Fire Brigade. It was decided that a fire station should again be sited in Leaden Roding and in 1952 a wooden fire station was erected. Local men were recruited to man the station, on a part time basis, and in 1953 the station became operational. At that time they had a Land Rover which towed its pump on a trailer. The present station was opened on October 27th 1962.
